channel.title: Just a LITTLE! problem
channel.description: whatevr shop, if you click on "buy 10" it give you like more than 10, a full inven in fact, where would i change this, cheers.

item.title: Just a LITTLE! problem
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“i call dueces, post:12, topic:528144”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=646895.msg4350302#msg4350302 date=1376525356]

i knew it was… but sk8 goes check “bank.java”…

No.
I said Bank10.java
They were talking about a specific piece of code.
Bank5, Bank10, BankX1, and BankX2 are all packets that are used on interfaces. (Typically, the bank, buying, selling, and trades). They just have the name Bank on them because someone found that easiest to use when they named it…

not sure what base you’re using, but from what I see, there are two cases that deal with buying/selling

[code] switch(interfaceId){
case 1688:
c.getPA().useOperate(removeId);
break;
case 3900:
c.getShops().buyItem(removeId, removeSlot, 5);
break;

                    case 3823:
                    c.getShops().sellItem(removeId, removeSlot, 5);
                    break; [/code]

if you still cant find it, try posting the whole method

There is nothing wrong with that. One is to handle buying and one is to handle selling…
[/quote]yes, sk8rd00d, but thats not the entire method. seeing how i dont own ever server in the world, i have no clue whats going on entirely.[/quote]
I know, I said something about it:

sk8rdude461:

I have no idea where you got that code from, You just pasted the generic code found in almost all the bank packets.

Read full topic

item.title: Just a LITTLE! problem
item.dc:creator: @warxscape warxscape
item.description:
@warxscape wrote:

nope didnt work

[code=java]public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) {
int interfaceId = c.getInStream().readUnsignedWordBigEndian();
int removeId = c.getInStream().readUnsignedWordA();
int removeSlot = c.getInStream().readUnsignedWordA();

	switch(interfaceId){
		case 1688:
			c.getPA().useOperate(removeId);
		break;
		case 3900:
		c.getShops().buyItem(removeId, removeSlot, 5);
		break;
		
		case 3823:
		c.getShops().sellItem(removeId, removeSlot, 5);
		break;	

		case 5064:
		c.getItems().bankItem(removeId, removeSlot, 150);[/code]

changed the 150 (assuming its that slot, because it was 150 that was glitched, so i changed it to 10, still dont work?)

Read full topic
